course_description: This course occurs over two semesters, one credit hour in the fall (745A) and 2 credits in the spring (745B). Students are introduced to the basic elements of a medical genetics evaluation including dysmorphology, physical assessment, and differential diagnosis. The clinical features, natural history, counseling issues and management strategies for major pediatric and adult genetic diagnoses/syndromes are reviewed.
